title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 175.1 - Attendance periods of school year for state aid purposes
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 175.1 - Attendance periods of school year for state aid purposes

State Regulations
(a) Whenever 10 attendance periods shall be
established for the school year: (1)
such
periods shall run consecutively and shall end either: (i) on the last Friday of each calendar
month, September through June; or
(ii)
after the completion of each 18 days of
session except that the tenth period shall end after completion of the last day
of session of the school year. (2)

Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this
subdivision, in the city school district of the City of New York such periods
shall run consecutively and may, in the discretion of the board of education of
that district, end either as defined in paragraph (1) of this subdivision or on
the last day of each such calendar month. (b) Whenever eight attendance periods shall
be established for the school year, each such period shall be contained within
at least five consecutive calendar weeks. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
175.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
